column1: ooh, great start from Amir. Tentative from Rohit. Was just propping forward and pushing at the ball on a fifth-stump line, outside off. May have played for the swing - it just went on with the angle and beat his outside edge
phew, another beauty. This one's even better. This one starts closer to off stump, forces Rohit to play on this occasion, and again, no swing, but lots of bounce, beats the edge with the angle
length ball, pitches wider outside off, easily left alone

and again - he's beaten Rohit three times in four balls now. He's yet to put bat on ball. This one's slanted wide again, a bit fuller, inviting the drive. It isn't quite on a driving length, though, and again the  ball misses his outside edge
back of a length, slanting across towards off stump. Plays slightly outside the line of this one in defence, thick inside edge cannons into thigh pad
length ball, pitching on off and angling away, left alone
slants this across, back of a length, no turn back in. Waits on the back foot and dabs it to the left of backward point, who muffs up a fairly straightforward diving stop
fired in fuller and he ends up bowling it down the leg side as Dhawan misses the sweep
flat and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball with a bit of drift towards off stump, no turn back in. Defended into the on side
length ball pitching on off and swerving away from the left-hander, punched to cover point
back of a length now, again goes with the arm rather than swinging in, goes back and across to punch into the covers
full on leg stump, clipped straight to backward square leg
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
full outside off, leans forward and eases the ball into the extra-cover region
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
fullish on off stump, defended back down the pitch, towards the non-striker
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
fuller now, in that off-stump channel, brings him forward to defend into the covers. Rohit's footwork has looked a lot more confident in this over
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
back of a length outside off, whipped away to long-on
length ball on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, goes deep in his crease to work it through backward square leg
full on middle and leg, defended to midwicket, shows the full face
full, drifting into middle stump, pushed gently into the covers and they take on the quick single. Make it easily despite a direct hit at the bowler's end
back of a length on middle stump, looks to tuck it into the midwicket region, but the angle ensures he plays it too close to the bowler's follow-through to get a single

bouncer now, well-directed, rises over Rohit's right shoulder. Takes on the hook - he knows fine leg is inside the circle - and it hits the outside half of the bat but almost carries all the way to the rope
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked into the square leg region
ooh, good ball, a bit of late swing in. Full, angling into off stump. Looks to stay leg-side of the ball and drive through cover, gets a thick inside edge instead, to long leg
length ball, slanted a bit wider outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, takes a half step forward and across to punch towards point
fullish, swinging across towards off stump, clipped to midwicket
down the track now and Imad slows it down and drifts it away from Dhawan, who stretches forward to defend into the covers
quicker and flatter, the angle taking it towards the top of off stump. Waits on the back foot and chops into the point region
a touch short now, on off stump, and Rohit rocks back and punches it to the left of the cover point fielder
down the track, Imad shortens his length outside off, waits and stabs to backward point
back of a length, not too much room outside off as Dhawan steps back to cut. Ends up dragging it straighter than he wants, into the covers

shortish, slanting across towards off stump, and Rohit flirts with danger here. Two slips in place and he looks to run it down to third man with an open face. Hits the outside half of the bat and just eludes the fingertips of Azhar diving right from second slip
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to play that cautiously down to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to the right of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, straightens slightly, defended back towards the bowler
length ball on off stump, gets on the front foot and pushes towards mid-off, calls immediately for the single
down the track and Imad fires it at Dhawan's pads. Clipped to deep square leg
full on middle and leg, almost a yorker, shows the full face to push towards long-on

back of a length on off stump, and that's nicely done. He knows there won't be too much turn, so he makes himself room, watches the ball all the way, and forces a cut to the left of the diving backward point fielder. Gets a hand on it, may have gone for four otherwise

back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off. Takes off immediately, Rohit is slow to respond, and they make it comfortably in the end. Rohit slyly runs in the way of the throw - and gets hit on the back. Not sure if it's strictly okay to do
full on middle stump, pushed to mid-off
fullish outside off, driven to cover point
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and knocks it towards point
back of a length on middle stump, defended to short extra-cover. Pakistan have done well to deny Dhawan width
full on middle and leg, clipped to the right of long leg

back of a length, close to off stump. He doesn't need too much width, though. Just waits on the back foot, and times a defensive push so exquisitely that backward point, diving right, has no chance of stopping the ball
short outside off, and Rohit rocks back to pull, doesn't connect, though. Skidded through quicker, and maybe didn't bounce as much as he expected
back of a length outside off, left alone
bang. A bit of air from Imad, floated it up towards off stump, and Dhawan immediately stretches forward and hammers a sweep up and over square midwicket

back of a length on leg stump, opens up and whips towards deep midwicket - who's just been pushed back. And Pakistan concede an overthrow as well. Fielder comes in, throws inaccurately to Sarfraz, and the ball runs away into the fine leg region. Not sure who the fielder was. To be fair to him, Sarfraz wasn't really watching the ball too closely either.
ooh, a little lazy from Rohit. Length ball angling towards off stump. Plays for the turn, not really getting forward, and the ball slides on and hits high on the inside edge
down the track now and Imad pulls his length back while angling it into Rohit's pads. Looks to hit over mid-on, ends up dragging it wide, through midwicket
on the stumps, works this away to deep midwicket
tossed up and straight outside off, no real turn, Rohit has a short stride forward as he drops it defensively to cover
full and angling away just outside off, patted into the covers
in-between length. Neither full nor short - attacking the stumps - Dhawan hurriedly blocks it to the off side
really full and attached with width outside off, Dhawan doesn't need second invitations. He throws his hands at it and carves it away to the left of sweeper
very full and angled in, aiming for off stump, Rohit's push to mid-on intervenes. Hasan's front foot has strayed. Big no-ball

Rohit tunes up for a big hit. Goes over the top. Hasan attempts a yorker, ends up bowling an off-stump full-toss. Rohit does not get hold of it but still clears mid-on. Cashes in on the free-hit. Rohit and Dhawan are back at it with a fifty opening stand
good length and zipping through the channel outside off, no shot offered
short of a length and outside off, Rohit goes a bit hard on the cut and ends up chopping the ball to cover
full, non-turner on off, driven down to long-on for a single
full and angled in on off, front-foot drive to long-off, this time from Rohit
flat and darted on the pads, picked off to the right of the square-leg umpire for one
tossed outside off, Rohit presses forward and eases it to cover
skids on off, shoots low as well, but Rohit jams his bat down and keeps this inducker out
full on off, driven crisply on the front foot again, but short cover makes a tumbling save to limit it to a dot
Dhawan shimmies down the track, Hasan drags his length back on middle, Dhawan quietly pushes it to cover
length and angling across off, Dhawan opens the face and steers it to the right of a diving Shadab at backward point. The fielder was wrong-footed, as the ball evaded his fingertips
possibly a slower ball on the leg stump, Dhawan does not spot the change-up. Flicks early, the ball deflects to midwicket off the pad
follows the slower ball to the left-hander, with a big bouncer outside off. Bangs it into the middle of the deck, sails over the gloves of the batsman. Rohit did well to drop his hands on it
short and angled in on leg stump, Rohit uses the angle and manipulates a single to the right of the leg umpire
tests Dhawan with a lifter now. This one angles away from the left-hander. Dhawan bails out of the hook and lets it through to Sarfraz
slings a very full ball wide outside off, Rohit is happy to shoulder arms
short of a length and outside off, hits the bat hard, defended to cover
really full and wide outside off, Rohit flashes a long way away from his body... and misses. His feet got sucked into a black hole at the crease
short on leg stump, directed down to long leg for a single
full and angling into the pads of Dhawan from over the wicket, clipped away to long leg
Rohit flashes at another wide one with his hands. This one he connects but can't beat the off-side sweeper
full on off, Rohit defends it back on the front foot
back of a length and angled in, clipped through the vacant spaces at midwicket for a couple. India ticking along nicely
short of a length and outside off, Rohit jumps onto the width, punching to backward point, where teenager Shadab flings himself to is right to stop a potential four
full and in the channel outside off, Rohit opts to watch it through to the keeper
pitched up and outside off, Rohit simply leans into it and drives to sweeper. Crisp
123ks slower ball on off, Dhawan reads the drop in pace, waits for the ball to arrive, then turns it to square leg for one
full on middle, 142ks, Dhawan eyes up the leg side. Flicks early and spoons a leading edge to the left of Wahab
shortish on the hips, worked away through backward square leg for one

full and angled in, but the line is too straight, flicked with the wrists to deep backward square leg. Rohit is eager for the second, but Dhawan sends him back. Rohit slips, but still has enough time to reach safety. The throw was well in front of the stumps
shot! Pitched up and outside off, Rohit simply hits through the line hits crisply. Drives over extra cover
short of a length and outside off, run down to third man. Hasan isn't fine enough in the deep. He runs across to his left, and slides at the edge of the boundary to keep it to one
wrong line, full and slung down leg. Re-set the radar, Wahab
dug short and wide outside off, Wahab overcorrects it, Dhawan cuts it uppishly over backward point and finds a boundary. Thirteen runs off the over
length-ball legbreak outside off, spins away, Rohit opens the face and dabs a single to short third man
goes short on the leg stump, Dhawan steps back and pulls straight to deep square leg
really full, no turn outside off, square-driven along the ground, for a single
tossed up, full on off, nurdled through square leg for one
starts around off and breaks away, dabbed to short third man, again
drops it short, there it is, attempted googly, there it is, but the length isn't right, Rohit punches it down to long-on for one
full and outside off, opens the face and drives to point
back of a length and outside off, Rohit still can't fine the gap. Opens the face and runs it straight to point
hip-high short ball on leg stump, slower in pace, Rohit swivels on the back foot and helps it to fine leg
full on off, Dhawan unleashes a punchy drive, beats cover to his left, but can't beat mid-off to his right
length ball angling across off, tip and run to cover, smart running from the openers
short, rising ball on off, surprises Dhawan. He arches his back and manages to fend it to point
short on off, punched back to the right of Shadab
very full on off, Rohit drives it straight back to the bowler again

Rohit top-edges the slog-sweep and watches the ball drop between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Tossed-up legbreak, bounces more than Rohit expected it to. He stretches forward for a slog-sweep and gets away
full on off, pushed back to the bowler
Crunched over midwicket. Fine way to bring up a fifty. Welcome back to international cricket, Rohit. This was a bad ball, though. Half-tracker outside off, Rohit rocks back and pulls over midwicket
better length. Pitched up on off, no room, defended back
short on middle, cramps Dhawan for room, chopped straight to point
short outside off, Dhawan uses the pace of Wahab and cuts it uppishly, fine of deep third man
another tripe ball from Wahab. Leg-stump half-volley, glanced away fine on the leg side for back-to-back fours

Wahab hits the deck hard but this is again a bad ball. Short and wide outside off, Dhawan loves width. He jumps off his feet and cuts uppishly again. Hit over backward point. One-bounce four. Wahab continues to leak runs
Fifty for Dhawan as well! Slower ball outside off, opens the face and taps it to the left of backward point. Shadab fumbles, letting the ball through his fingers
back of a length on off stump, dropped to the left of Shadab at backward point for one
Launched over midwicket. Dhawan gallops down the track, meets the pitch of this very full ball - he manufactured his own length and whacked the googly over midwicket
driven through the line to long-off, this time all along the ground
slower, dipping legbreak, nudged to cover for one
full and straight, clipped to the left of midwicket for one more
starts on off and spins away, played with the spin to point with soft hands
tossed up outside off, driven to the left of cover and to the right of sweeper.
sliding into the pads, worked to square leg on the back foot
picked off the pads to deep midwicket
straight ball on off, pushed to the right of cover on the front foot
flighted on off, push-driven to long-off
short on off, steps back and punches sweetly but finds cover
Malik keeps firing 'em in on the pads, nudged through square leg
floated up on middle and leg, milked to long-on.
near yorker on middle, jabbed back to Shadab
full legbreak on leg stump, Dhawan drives a single to long-on
quicker wrong'un, 102ks, Rohit does not pick it. He looks to drive through cover, squirts an inside edge to square leg
Dhawan shimmies out and hits it back to Shadab
short legbreak, Dhawan jumps outside leg and punches it to cover for one
Dhawan uses his feet, Malik shortens his length and attacks the hips, pushed down to long-on
full and straight, worked to the right of midwicket
another flat dart on the pads, picked off through midwicket
full on off, steps forward and drives to cover
skids into leg stump, Dhawan goes low and directs it fine of short fine leg with a sweep
straight ball on middle, defended back
pushed through outside off, square-driven with the spin
Dhawan skips out, Shadab holds this back on off. Dhawan gets too close to the ball ends up pushing it back

Hits it straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Pakistan, finally, break the rousing opening stand. This seemed to have slipped out of his hand, Dhawan races down the track, takes a full-toss and mows it straight to Azhar Ali in the deep
greets the Indian captain with a wrong'un. He does not pick it, plays down the wrong line and squirts an inside edge to leg
shorter than the previous ball, punched past the right of the bowler
short legbreak outside off, cut out to sweeper
full and angled in on middle, bunted to long-on
skids on outside off, punchily played to point
full on middle, defended back to Imad, who tumbles to his right to stop the ball
hint of turn outside off, pushed to point on the front foot
really full and straight, Kohli goes deep in the crease and flicks to midwicket
Rohit uses his feet and works to leg for one
flatter wrong'un. Full, Rohit does not pick it, inside-edges it to square leg
really full on off, straight ball, driven down to long-off
really full on off, shovel-driven with the bottom hand to long-on
length ball, spins away outside off, stretches forward and times a drive to deep cover
short legbreak outside off, goes back and punches firmly through the covers

tossed up full on off stump, tip and run to cover point. The fielder from cover swoops down on the ball, Kohli was late to react for the single, but Rohit still makes it as the throw was very wide. Sarfraz fails to collect
short and turns away outside off, solidly punched to sweeper
flat on middle, driven to long-on
slides on outside off, Kohli waits for the ball to arrive, opens the face and runs it fine of short third man
very full on off, Kohli secures another single down the ground
short and angled in on off, stands tall and punches a single down to long-on
full on the stumps, backs away outside leg and drills it past cover, long-off runs to his left and hunts it down
dipping legbreak, Rohit goes leg side of the ball and drops a leading edge to the left of the bowler
short and slides in, goes back and whips it through midwicket
tossed up on off, defended on the front foot
short and spins away outside off, punched to long-on
legbreak outside off skewed back to the bowler. Rare dot
full and outside off, Kohli brings his bottom hand into play and whiplashes to long-o
length ball angling away around off, defended back
back of a length and angling across off, guided down to deep third man
good length and angled across off stump, Rohit simply watches it through to the keeper
similar ball, Rohit is happy to leave these in the channel
good length and outside off, Rohit opts to play, driving on the up to cover
full and slanting away outside off, opens the face and dabs it straight to backward point. Four dots in the over - Amir gives Sarfraz that control
full and outside off, Kohli lets it pass
full on off, whipped to mid-on
wide of the crease, angled in, cramps Rohit for room, awkwardly fended to leg
full, swerves in on off, Rohit jams his bat down at an angle and inside-edges it onto the pad
back of a length ball on off, Rohit aims to swat it over mid-on, ends up dragging it to the fielder
bouncer on off stump, forces Rohit to duck under it. Nine dots in the last two overs
full on off, Kohli uses his feet and flicks it to the right of Wahab at mid-on
short and angled across off, rides the bounce, and helps it down to deep third man
back of a length and angled across off, sweetly punched to deep backward point
very full on off, Rohit squeezes to cover
much fuller on off, driven past the right of mid-on, can't beat Wahab
short and outside off, angling away outside off, rare bad ball from Amir. Kohli jumps on top of it and flays it up and over backward point
shortish outside off, slapped to backward point
length ball, nips back in slightly towards off stump, Rohit gets on the front foot to defend
short now, on off stump, Rohit pulls and midwicket dives right to stop it
shortish slower ball outside off, simply doesn't come on for the cut. Rohit chops it a short distance away, square on the off side, off the inner half of the bat
this is a quicker short ball, gets up above Kohli's right shoulder as he shapes to hook. Can't put bat to ball
short again, angling into Kohli's body at neck height. Steps across and tucks it into the backward square leg region
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off, stabbed away towards third man
fuller now, slanting away from off stump, Rohit presses forward and defends into the covers
length ball on off and middle, defended to short extra-cover
slower length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point. Fielder comes in quickly to cut off the single

back of a length outside off, and all these dots are definitely playing on Rohit's mind. Dabs it towards backward point, too close to the fielder to pick up a single, but he hurtles out of his crease anyway. Kohli sends him back, and he dives home as the throw misses the stumps
short outside off, a bit of extra bounce and Kohli's cut slices off the outside half of the bat towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
long-hop on middle stump, pulled away to the right of deep square leg
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and stabs to backward point
tossed up full on off stump, driven firmly and Imad dives forward and short extra-cover to stop it
length ball outside off, a bit of turn, Kohli leaves it alone
Shortish, close to off stump, Rohit looks to steer it towards third man with an open face and extra bounce takes it past his outside edge
streaky. Fuller and wider, Rohit throws his hands at the ball without moving his feet. Thick outside edge rolls down to third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
shot! That's stand and deliver. Fullish outside off, not a half-volley. Rohit doesn't really move forward at all, just stands there and drives on the up, and bisects mid-off and extra-cover
follows up with a long-hop on off stump, and Rohit swivels and swats that away over deep square leg
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and steers it to third man
tossed up full on off stump, whipped to long-on
googly, pitches short and fairly wide outside off, lets it come on and dabs to short third man
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on

tossed up outside off, and Kohli may have endangered Rohit's innings here. Stretches out and pushes into the point region, calls immediately for the single. Babaz runs in quickly from backward point, fires in a throw to Sarfraz, and Rohit, diving desperately, could be out in slightly unfortunate fashion here, his bat bouncing at impact and the part that is past the crease in the air when the bails go off. Is the bat in the air? The third umpire is checking. Given out, and from the angles shown, that seemed the right conclusion. They only showed the angle from point, though, not from square leg
tossed up on off stump, begins with a nice straight bat to drive down to long-on
full on off stump, whipped with a lot of bottom hand to long-on
length ball wide of off stump, driven on the up to deep point
back of a length close to off stump, jumps to ride the bounce and drops it gently into the point region
shortish outside off, dabbed away fine to the left of third man
bouncer in the channel outside off, Yuvraj sways his head away from the line and evades it

full on middle stump, and that's nice timing. Just a straight-bat punch, and the ball flies away even though his bat turns on impact, beats mid-on to his left and eludes him despite a desperate chase and dive
short now, pulled along the ground to deep square leg
googly, pitches on a good length on middle and off and turns away. Stretches forward and blocks into the cover point region
tossed up wide of off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length, turning towards off stump, punched down the ground to long-on

dropped. Hasan Ali puts down a sitter. Sees Yuvraj stepping out and bowls the wrong'un. Yuvraj slices his big hit out to long-off, who runs in, slides to his right, gets both hands to the chance, and drops it
shortish, turned into the leg side
another googly, pitches outside leg this time, comes forward to whip to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed down to third man
back of a length close to off stump, jabbed away to backward point
shortish, a bit of width, and that's nicely done, chops it hard into the ground and it bounces up and eludes the backward point fielder diving to his left. Deep point moves right to stop it
again short with some width, and this time he opens his bat face and times his slice beautifully. Shadab dives right and makes an excellent stop at backward point
short again, but this one is dug in hard, a bouncer that gets up over Yuvraj's left shoulder and is too quick for him to hook

slower ball, too much width though. Yuvraj was already giving himself some room, and he spots the slower one, steadies himself, and uses that reach of his to slap it away crisply and beat deep point running to his left
short on off stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched firmly and straight to backward point
length ball outside off, slapped away to deep point
yorker, close to off stump, and that's unfortunate for Hasan. Yuvraj looks to whip it into the on side, gets a thick inside edge that just misses off stump
shortish outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
full on middle and off, makes room but it's too full for him to go inside-out, jabs it to mid-off
full, drilled to long-on
length ball on middle stump, clipped away through midwicket
low full-toss outside off, jabbed down to mid-off
slower short ball, and that's a super shot from Yuvraj. He was into position early for the pull, but he held his shape, waited an instant, and then swatted it away to the left of midwicket
sees Yuvraj making room and follows him with a yorker close to his feet. Again, keeps a lovely still head, waits, and opens his bat face to squeeze it down to third man
full on off stump, whipped to deep midwicket
well bowled. Kohli made room, but went too early, and Hasan responded with the perfect wide yorker. Reached out to try and jab it away, but couldn't put bat to ball
excellent again. This is the off-stump yorker, with a bit of late inswing. Opens his bat face and stabs to backward point

whoa, what timing is that! That's very close to being a yorker, maybe missed it by an inch, no more. Yuvraj cleared his front leg slightly, and ball met ball next to his front foot, and he just shows the full face and hammers it down the ground, giving long-off no chance diving to his left
wide yorker, Yuvraj reaches out to force it away but can't connect
slower short ball on off stump, and this is vintage Yuvraj. Opens up at the hips and pulls it away over square leg
sees him looking to make room and bowls a length ball outside leg stump. Looks to flick, can only get pad onto ball, which rolls away into the leg side
short ball close to off stump, pulled away, but this time he doesn't time it as well, bounces down into the deep square leg region. The leg-side boundary is longer when he's facing from this end
full outside off, swiped hard down the ground, lots of bottom hand, along the ground to long-on
slower short ball on middle stump, he saw Yuvraj looking to make room. Saw it late, and ended up swatting it down, tennis-smash style, into the leg side for one
full, just outside off, and there's that bottom-handed Kohli whip we've seen so many times. Except he hits this straight to midwicket

Dropped. Fakhar Zaman running in from deep square leg. Slower bouncer slanting across to off stump, stopped on Kohli as he shaped to pull. Went through with the shot, top-edged it, and Zaman, who's come onto the field to substitute for Amir, slides in, gets both hands to it, and drops it
full slower ball on middle stump, shovelled in the air down the ground, lands around halfway to long-on. Didn't time it at all

low full-toss outside off, and Yuvraj can power these like no one else. Just punches it with a straight bat, hits it flat over the bowler, and long-on, despite having not much ground to cover to his right, has no chance of stopping it
wide yorker, stabbed away a short distance into the covers

slower ball, shortish on off stump, and Kohli brings up fifty with a six. He's been struggling to time the ball, and this one he just muscles, clears his front leg and flat-bats over long-on. Reacts with a yell to himself
full on off stump, squeezed away to sweeper cover
full-toss on off stump, and Yuvraj bashes it away. Again, just a straight-bat punch after clearing his front leg, smacks it to the left of long-on

wide yorker, and Kohli puts it away. Third man is very square, and he reaches out, meets it on the full with the toe end of his open-faced bat, and beats the fielder to his left. What's more, he's overstepped.
looks for the yorker on the stumps, ends up bowling a half-volley close to Kohli's pads, and he whips it away over midwicket
that Amir injury is really hurting Pakistan here. Length ball on middle stump, and he just clears his front leg and shovels it with a straight bat over wide long-on
back of a length outside off, dabs it away to third man

ah, well. He's hit some astounding shots off the middle of that bat, and now he gets to fifty with a boundary off the edge. Bouncer, and his top-edged hook flies to the boundary to the right of the keeper
makes room now and Wahab bangs it in short outside off. Doesn't time the uppercut too well, loops up and lands a fair distance in front of third man
fired in flat and wide of off stump, the left-arm spinner's wide yorker. Virat leaves it, and looks at the umpire expectantly, but he doesn't signal wide
full outside off, not quite a wide yorker but close enough, driven hard to short extra

big appeal for lbw, Marais Erasmus isn't interested. Sarfraz asks for a review. Full, a near-yorker close to leg stump. Yuvraj looks to flick, misses, and the ball hits his foot. Did that pitch outside leg, though? No bat on it, I think. HotSpot suggests the toe of the bat hit the ground. Big distance between bat and ball. What says ball-tracking? Pitching just in line, and once we've established that, Yuvraj will have to walk back. That's crashing into middle stump, fairly low
yorker close to off stump, jabbed away towards backward point
misses the yorker, ends up bowling a half-volley outside off, and Kohli pummels a punchy drive to the extra-cover boundary
full again, wider this time, and Kohli has smashed that. It's a brilliant shot, bringing his bottom hand to play to slice underneath the ball and lift it over cover. Wow
leg-stump yorker, well bowled. Can't do much but dig it out, back towards the bowler
Hardik starts it with a six. Full on off stump, he's cleared his front leg and launched it high over long-off
full again, but not full enough to deny elevation. Wider this time, and Hardik launches this over wide long-off, a more flat-batted hit on this occasion
three in a row! This one's pulled back slightly, and he's bowled it slower, on off stump. Hardik uses that extra time to step across, go down on one knee, and slog-sweep over deep midwicket

looks to slog-sweep again, and Imad denies him with one that's slowed down just enough. Swings too early, and misses. Ball hits high, over his back thigh and on his stomach. He was down on one knee, though. Pakistan have reviewed the not-out decision... Pitching on middle, straightening, and projected to tickle the bails. Umpire's call
full on off stump, flat-batted in the air, on the bounce, to long-off
tossed up wide of off stump, a hit-me ball, and Kohli ends the innings with a boundary, driving in the air, into the gap between sweeper cover and long-off
full and slanting down the leg side, left alone, wide
back of a length and angled in on off, defended to mid-on
swing for Bhuvneshwar. Pitched up outside off, shapes away nicely outside off, Azhar leaves it be
Azhar chases this. Short and wide outside off, he throws his bat at the ball, wide called. Tight call, think it was on the guideline
back of a length and angled in, shuffles across and punches to mid-on
full, angled in, swings in, Azhar falls over and hurriedly flicks through midwicket
stands tall to this shortish ball outside off and punches to cover
full, largely holds its line outside off, Azhar lets it pass. The ball rolls through to Dhoni at ankle-height
full and skids on off, defended back to the bowler
short and width outside off, Shehzad latches onto it and cuts it left to backward point and to the right of square third man
full on middle and leg, no real lateral movement, Shehzad is stapled to the crease as he pushes to mid-on
wide of the crease, angled in on a back of a length, Shehzad hangs back and works it between mid-on and midwicket
very full and skids back in on off, 142ks, Azhar urgently squirts an inside edge onto the pad
dug short on middle stump, Azhar swivels on the back foot and controls a pull to long leg. Just a single, despite the fumble in the deep
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to cover
back of a length and hurries on off, jabbed straight of mid-on. They take on Yuvraj's arm for a single
back of a length and outside off, wafted down to third man

full and angled in on off and middle, shuffles across off and flicks it sweetly through square leg. Bumrah dives to his left from long leg and makes a tumbling save, scooping the ball back into the field of play. Saves one run for his team
short of a length and cuts back in on middle, hustles him for pace. Defended back
full and rolls through to Dhoni at shin-height as the batsman had let it go
this is a top ball from Umesh. Pitched up, hint of nip away outside off, Azhar plays inside the line and watches the ball beat the outside edge. Nervous little prod
shorter and on off - or just outside - punched to mid-off
short and wide outside off, second slip had just shifted to point, this is slashed wide of point
short of a length and angled in on off, Shehzad jumps back and fends to midwicket for a quick one
shortish and skids on off, not short enough for a pull, thigh-ball ball. Azhar swings to leg side and misses
chest-high short ball on off stump, Azhar takes it on with a pull. Sends it over backward square leg for his first boundary
a beauty from Bhuvneshwar. He ventures wide of the crease, angles it in, and gets it to swing away outside off, Shehzad chases it with a loose drive and is beaten neck and crop
Bhuvneshwar drags his length back on middle Defended
full, angled in, straightens a bit, defended back to the bowler

goes wide of the crease again, very full and angled in, beats the attempted flick and pings the pad, but this was going down with the exaggerated angle from over the wicket. Kohli decides against the review
really full on off, played back to the bowler
back of a length and angled in on off stump, punched straight to mid-on
just short of a good length and travels in a straight line outside off, punchily defended to cover
short and wide outside off, steered away to deep third man
length and outside off, Azhar presses forward and punchily drives to mid-off
140ks, on a length and wide outside off, not short enough for the cut although the line was ripe for the cut. Whistles past the outside edge
full and angled in on off, forward and driven straight down the ground, past the bowler, mid-on moves to his left and mops up
short and width outside off, right line and length to cut. Azhar does not really move his feet, but swishes it past backward point. The ball flies to the boundary
short and outside off, rides the bounce and taps to backward point
back of a length and outside off, Azhar jumps across off and punches to cover, where Dhawan moves to his right and fumbles, allowing a single
slightly short and outside off, allows the ball to come to him and late-cuts it to the left of Jadeja at backward point. Third man has it covered
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up between mid-off and covers

this is a cracker from Bhuvneshwar. Azhar walks at the bowler, movement and bounce for the seamer. Back of a length, angled in, and straightens away past the batsman who was aiming to play across the line
good length and angled in on off, pushed to mid-on
short and skids on just outside off, opens the face and glides to point
much fuller and outside off, driven on the up to cover point
good length and angled in on off, bunted to mid-on
shortish and outside off, lets it slide off the face to deep third ma
Azhar hits on the up and nails it straight of mid-on. Length ball on middle, clears his front leg and pumps it down the ground

full and outside off, driven into the covers, they chance a quick single. Azhar and Bumrah ram into each other. A direct hit at the bowler's end could have had Azhar. Pandya misses the run-out chance and Azhar gets away
full and outside off, laced to the left of backward point, and to the right of third man
back of a length and angled in, worked past midwicket for one
length and outside off, run down to third man
free-flowing drive, beats mid-on to his right. So easy on the eye. Pitched up and outside off - not really a half-volley - driven between the bowler and mid-off
back of a length and goes straight outside off, Azhar eyes up the leg side, and squirts a leading edge to third man

Bhuvneshwar provides India with the breakthrough. Shehzad has been given out leg-before. Shehzad chats with his partner and Pakistan decide against a review. Bhuvneshwar ventures wide of the crease, on a length and angled in, Shehzad plays across the line and is rapped on the front pad in front of off. The tracker returns three reds. Kohli roars and gives Shehzad a send-off
short and rises outside off, Azhar rides the bounce and upper-cuts it to third man, the man in the deep was not fine enough to cut if off
back of a length and outside off, jabbed to point
full and straight, whisked to midwicket
slower cutter outside off, waits for the ball to arrive and taps to point
back of a length and angled in on off, stops on the batsman, check punched to cover
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
good length on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
full and nips away outside off, movement off the pitch, beats the outside edge
good length and outside off, solidly pushed into the covers
Babar shuffles across off and drills a full ball back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover
pitched up and outside off, eased to mid-off. Umesh starts with a maiden
back of a length and slanted into the thigh, deflected fine on the leg side. Leg bye
back of a length and outside off, run down to third man
on a length and angled in, pushed to mid-on with the angle
tight line on off, angled in, defended to cover
too straight in line, Babar shuffles across and nicely flicks to midwicket, where Bhuvneshwar fumbles

full and skids back in, inside-edged onto the pad. The ball drops onto the pitch. Babar chances a single. Bumrah runs in, attacks the ball, this is a dash between the bowler and Azhar. Bumrah can't underarm flick it into the stumps. Azhar dives full-length and makes his crease
short and width outside off, flayed away to the left of backward point, deep third man runs to his right and makes a mess of it. Jadhav dives early and watches the ball defeat him
short and wide outside off - much like the previous ball - Babar slashes in the air again, this time Jadeja moves to his right from backward point and tracks it down
nearly shaved the off stump. Good length, angled in, Hafeez opts to shoulder arms. Tight, tight leave
full and outside off, opens the face and plays to point
pitched up and outside off, driven on the up to Kohli at mid-off
Umesh hits the deck hard. Banged in short and just outside off, Hafeez can't connect with a pull
full and outside off, driven with an open face to point
on a length and outside off, presses forward and drives to the right of cover
Dropped by Bhuvneshwar running in from long-on. The ball bobbles out. Azhar runs down the track, meets a length ball and drags it in the air. Bhuvneshwar lets him off after covering so much ground
back of a length on the stumps, defended
length on off, gets forward and drives to mid-off
full and outside off, driven to cover on the front foot
back of a length, hits the deck, and seams away outside off, beats the cut
full and outside off, gets forward and plays a jabbing drive to mid-off with the bat-face turning on impact
back of a length and outside off, late-cut to third man
short on leg stump, cramps him for room and strikes the thigh
gorgeous shot from Hafeez. Full and outside off, Hafeez presses forward, drives on the up to the left of cover
full and holds its line outside off, left alone
good length and outside off, uses his wrists and guides it to third man
back of a length and angled in on off, hits the bat hard, defended to cover
pitched up on off, gets forward, opens the face and square-drives it through point
back of a length and outside off, punched out to sweeper
chest-high short ball on off, hustles the batsman, a weak pull is the response. Top-edged to long leg
bouncer, legside-ish, flies over the left shoulder as the batsman was aiming to hook. Wide called

It has been a day of mistakes in the field. Yuvraj is the culprit now. Banged in short and outside off, rides the bounce, and ramps it to the right of Yuvraj at deep third man. Lazy effort from Yuvraj
uppish drive to the left of Kohli at short cover
runs down the track, this is flatter and faster, hitting the pad
arm-ball from Jadeja. An appeal for lbw, not given by umpire Dharmasena. Azhar plays across the line, hit in line with the stumps, but this was probably bouncing over
full on middle, inside-out drive to long-off
flat dart on leg stump, diverted to short fine leg
back of a length on the stumps, defended
full and outside off, reaches out with his hands for a cover drive and wafts an inside edge to leg
short and slanted in, cramps the batsman for room, chopped in front of his feet
wide of the crease, flicked with the angle to deep midwicket
sharp bouncer outside off, beats the hook, as the batsman was late onto it
short ball outside off, hip-high ball, swatted away to deep midwicket now
dropped short on middle and leg, another hip-high ball, Hafeez is quick to pick up the length. Steps back and pulls strongly to the right of the leg umpire
uses his feet, Jadeja shortens his length, check punched to cover, where Kohli misfields
down the track, meets a flat, fast ball, worked to midwicket
another appeal for lbw, not given by Dharmasena. Pushed through flat and quick on middle, Azhar misses the sweep. Looks adjacent. A tickle off the glove/inside edge saved him
arm ball, skids on, kept out
down the track, yorks himself, almost shot through the defences
back of a length and angled in, defended to leg
good length and angled in on off, blocked back
short of a length and angled in on off, another skiddy delivery, hurriedly whipped to midwicket
short and hurries on to ping the thigh pad after beating the pull
wide of the crease, back of a length, angled in on off, defended
back of a length and angled in, tapped to mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep square leg
down the pitch and Jadeja shortens his length slightly while denying Azhar room, punched back to the bowler
and again. Jadeja won't let him get close to the pitch while coming down the pitch. Punched to long-on to bring up fifty
length ball on middle and leg, swept to the left of deep square leg

goes for the sweep again, it's a touch shorter, though, and the bounce means he gets a top-edge. Easy catch at deep square leg, Hardik moves a few steps to his right and takes it with both hands, cupped at around shoulder height
length ball on off stump, a bit of a stutter as he pushes this into the covers and calls for a single. Sent back, rightly so
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
bouncer, rises sharply over off stump, sways the upper body away from the line
wide half-volley, a bit of a gift, reaches out and just slaps it away to the right of backward point. Too much work for the sweeper to do to cut it off to his left
back of a length on leg stump, long leg is back, but he's too square. Umesh makes a valiant attempt chasing to his right, but he had too much to do
short and wide, slapped away to the right of third man
fullish outside off, reaches out with his hands but doesn't really get forward to drive. Ends up slicing off the outside half of the bat to third man
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and stabs it to point
down the track now, and this time he gets into the perfect position against this off-stump ball. Gives himself a bit of room and uses his wrists to drive that over extra-cover
down the track again, Jadeja fires it straighter, pushed down the ground to long-off
back of a length, goes with the arm towards off stump. Makes room and cuts to backward point

down the track comes Malik, and he's always been an excellent six-hitter. Doesn't get too close to the pitch of the ball, but that allows him the elevation. Just goes through with the shot, finishes with bat over his left shoulder as this soars way up over the bowler and then the sightscreen
goes back to a length ball on off stump, pokes it gently towards backward point
fullish, a bit of swing in towards off stump. Comes forward to drive, maybe through mid-off or cover, but the swing forces him to push it back to the bowler
shortish, gets up to waist height on middle stump, pulled away to deep square leg

Ravindra Jadeja. What a left arm. Umesh sends down a length ball angling in towards top of off. Cramps Malik slightly, and he dabs it to the left of backward point and sets off for a single. He shouldn't have, because it was Jadeja moving quickly to the ball, towards his natural side. By the time he's realised and turned around, he's already out, caught out by a deadly, flat rocket of a direct hit
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
short and wide, Hafeez lashes out at it and doesn't connect. Didn't get his back foot across to cut
short, angling down leg, pulled to the right of long leg
shot. length ball outside off, stretches out and uses his hands deftly to lap-sweep fine and pick up four
fired in quicker, clipped into the midwicket region
tossed up on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and drives to the right of sweeper cover
flat length ball angling into leg stump, defended back towards the bowler
looks for that sweep again, dangerous given Jadeja's stump-to-stump line. Looks like a bit of edge onto pad
quick dart on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball on off stump, shuffles across and clips into the straight midwicket region
back of a length outside off, steered to the right of third man and they pick up another two. Nearly undone by Hafeeez almost running into Hardik on his way back for the second
back of a length on middle stump, worked away through square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to guide it to third man
shortish, ends up slanting it down the leg side. Sarfraz leaves it alone
back of a length on off stump, opens his bat face to dab to backward point
back of a length, follows Sarfraz's movement away from leg stump. Punched into the covers
quicker now, outside off, looks for the steer behind point, can't make contact
gone, Hafeez's rather tortured stay ends. Goes for the sweep from just outside off, makes decent contact but only picks out Bhuvneshwar running to his left rom deep square leg
full on leg stump, punched down the ground through wide mid-on
down the track and he doesn't get to the pitch. Ball goes on with the angle as Sarfraz stretches out to defend, hits him high on the pad
back of a length on off stump, chopped away through cover point
back of a length, angling into the hips, tucked away to backward square leg
back of a length again, angling into middle and leg, tucked off the hip to the left of Bumrah at backward square leg

length ball slanting away from off stump, and Imad Wasim is out first ball. No footwork, just flays at it, middles it but hits it uppishly and straight to Jadhav at cover point. Went straight to him, but hard, and he took it well, getting down low and holding it with two hands over his head
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched into the point region
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the cover point region

length ball, a little bit wider, gets a nice stride forward to push into the covers. Sets off for a single for no reason, because he almost hit that straight to Rohit Sharma, and he turns around in a hurry. Throw misses at the keeper's end, but I suppose he'd have been in anyway
back of a length close to off stump, pushed into the point region
quicker, on middle and leg this time, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
fuller now, on middle stump, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
down the track now and that's cleverly bowled. Slowed it down slightly, got it to go straight on into the body. Looked for the big hoick and only managed an inside-edge into his pads
a bit wider outside off, and he gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps powerfully over wide long-on
follows it with four more, nice shot. Drops a touch short, on off stump, goes right back and whips it away to the right of midwicket
shortish, once again ends up angling down the leg side
fullish outside off, gets forward for a punchy drive to mid-off

shot! That's a good-length ball, angling into off stump, and he gets forward, head over the ball, and just punches with a straight bat to bisect non-striker and umpire. Umesh dives left from mid-on but can't stop it

oh my, keeper nicks to keeper. Almost guides it to the keeper. Looks for the open-faced dab to third man, but this back-of-a-length ball didn't offer him enough width, and bounced a touch extra to catch the outside third of the bat
back of a length on off stump. Looks to punch towards mid-off, gets a thick edge into his thigh pad
bouncer over leg stump, Amir jumps and ducks at the same time to somehow evade it
short, wide, and that's slapped away hard but there's a man at deep point to mop up
full outside off, driven to long-off
full on off stump, driven to long-off
shortish, too close to off stump to cut, chops it away into the covers
flat and quick, fuller this time. Stays on the back foot to defend his off stump
a bit slower and wider, stretches out to defend towards backward point
sees him making room and fires it into leg stump. At least that's the target. Amir slashes and misses, and the ball narrowly misses leg stump
shortish, close to off stump, punched into the cover point region

dropped. There have been some sitters dropped today, but nothing quite as simple as this. Back of a length outside off, and he slogs hard. Gets a thick edge that loops up to the left of cover. Jadhav has a long time to move and then steady himself. Cups his hands below his chin - maybe he was better off holding them up nearer his eye-line - and the ball just slips through
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
a bit wider, and the attempted punch slices away towards third man
bouncer now, Amir ducks low to get under
short ball rising over leg stump. Hops to ride the bounce and bunts it gently into the midwicket region
short outside off, pulled to mid-on. Fielder throws and hits direct at the bowler's end, but no one was running
back of a length on middle and off, stays leg-side of the ball and pushes gently into the covers
ooh, good ball. Length ball, fifth-stump line, gets it to straighten after pitching and beat Shadab's nervy poke
shortish on off stump, pulled to mid-on. Was on to him quicker than he expected

short, angling into the body, and Shadab was in a very awkward position, late to react. Flaps at it in the end - it was more reflex than a considered stroke - and manages to play it down towards long leg. Throw hits direct at the bowler's end, but Shadab is safely home
full on middle and leg, punched to mid-off
shortish, at the batsman's hip, tucked away to long leg
length ball on middle and off. Looks to get forward and push into the covers, ends up inside-edging through midwicket
and another. Umesh gets his second. Back of a length, slanting across to off stump. Clears his front leg and looks to hit over cover, ends up hitting it flat, at catchable height
back of a length outside off, chopped towards point

shortish, angled into the body, and that is that. Wahab Riaz is not going to bat here. Cramped for room, beaten for pace, and he aims an aimless flick at the ball and loops the simplest of catches to Dhawan at midwicket
